Reviews.Title: “Serenissima Serenity”
Reviews.Author: geekygirlrex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have had the pleasure of staying here twice. For our first trip (which was our first trip to Venice and only 2 nights back in 2005) we had a lovely junior suite, which faces the back of the hotel. The space, accommodations and bathroom were really beautiful and very traditional. Our second time to Venice we stayed for 7 nights in a beautiful room facing the Grand Canal. What an amazing experience. The hotel is only a very very short walk to the vaparetto and about a ten minute walk to Piazza San Marco (once you discover the best route!). The hotel's staff could not be more gracious - especially the front desk staff. Each evening on our return, we would have a glass of Prosecco at the hotel bar while gazing out on the canal. The hotel is very, very clean. Breakfast is plentiful and the service is very good. We dream of returning and exploring Venice further. We stayed in the city for the entire seven days of our trip, not venturing out elsewhere...and we very glad we did as we got to discover each neighborhood's secrets. When we go back, this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelkeeney
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Venice couldn't have been better. This hotel is absolutely fantastic. Our room, 2nd floor corner room, and a wonderful little balcony with a gorgeous view of the Grand Canal. It was a little more expensive than I'm used to...but IMHO, totally worth every penny. The bar was delightful, the bartenders delightful, and the service delightful. I would stay here every time I go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: wsg1021
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this Hotel-a perfect Hotel;I requested a room with a view,on arrivalI was informed unfortunately they could not grant my equest and upgraded us to a junior suite,with a garden view and Gifts in our room.The breakfast was delightful,the Staff -a treasure;The location is the best in San Marco;We wanted coffee at 9;00PM and found a Brazilian cafe a short distance from the Hotel;Great food at Della Madonna by the Rialto bridge; I would like to thank the Manager and Staff for a most wonderful vacation; Wayne and Stephanie

Reviews.Title: “The perfect romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Claire T
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here recently on a romantic getaway (we got engaged here) and the overall hotel experience was perfect from the moment we arrived until the moment we departed. Highlights included: - being greeted at the private port when we arrived by water taxi - complementary bubbles, fruit basket and chocolate on arrival - gorgeous private balcony overlooking the grand canal - friendly recommendations for dinner - the restaurant we visited was amazing - on leaving we asked if we could buy the champagne glasses from our room as we wanted a souvenir for our engagement and they gifted them to us The Palazzo Sant'Angelo is an expensive choice, but if you're after a romantic, rememberable weekend then I would definitely recommend staying here. The dÃ©cor was rich and impressive. Lovely spa bath, comfy bed and the most amazing view over the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lovely little touches all round.”
Reviews.Author: wolfie23
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were really welcoming on arrival and had upgraded us to a better room without asking (ok, it's low season but it's nice to see that they could offer this at no extra cost during this quiet time). The porter was very friendly and even gave us a tour of the room, instructing us on how to operate the jacuzzi and various appliances around the room. The bed was huge too. Lovely little touches included turning our bed down for the evening, placing chocolates on the pillows, shutting the outside shutters just before bedtime and even taking the time to write down the following day's weather forecast on a card, which was placed on the bed. The room was cleaned well each day. Some reviews here say the breakfast is not up to scratch, but I really do think the hotel has taken these comments on board and improved this. There was a wide variety of options and we were really pleased with the choice. Amazing location too - the hotel has its own water taxi pick up and the aligunabus stop is right outside the hotel too. About a 10 minute walk to the Rialto bridge through the back streets - all in all a great hotel to stay at, fully fully recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: vangel23
Reviews.Content: We went there for a romantic treat. The hotel is ideally situated on the Grand Canal, which allowed us to visit all important places in 15 minutes (boat stop just outside the hotel) and go back to the room when needed. The room is nicely decorated and comfi. the bathroom was quite big. We had a nice view on the Grand Canal. There was some noise made by the boats but you can't ask a grand canal view and have a perfectly silent room ! But our neighbours complained about this. I was amazed by the view from our room. Breakfast was continental and average. It could be better from this high class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my birthday and what a treat it was. Amazing view over the grande canal, beautiful decorated room and lovely bathroom. Breakfast was avg but usual for Europe. Location is perfect, boat stop right outside and down the alley is the main pedestrian shopping street. Not cheap but highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Sant Angelo”
Reviews.Author: ScottishVoyageur
Reviews.Content: This is a high class establishment and one expects the service to correspond. It does. We had booked a 'superior' room and were not disappointed. The advantage of this hotel is its location - on the boat stop from the airport - therefore no lugging of luggage. Quiet and quite small therefore personal. Not the most economical place to stay in Venice, but for a special occasion (as ours was) it is excellent value. Would we return or recommend? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Venetian”
Reviews.Author: Rachel50_10
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel partly from reading Tripadvisor reviews, and it lived up to our expectations. The location is probably unbeatable. To emerge from the hotel each morning to the heart-stopping beauty of the Grand Canal is an extraordinarily joyous experience: and, to be practical, it's a bonus that the vaporetto stop is only a few metres away. Our room was spacious and quiet, with the large marble bathroom and jacuzzi admired by other reviewers. It was all immaculately clean, and the maid service was irreproachable - unobtrusive and efficient. We too loved the front desk staff, helpful and friendly at all times. Breakfast we found pretty good by the standards of Italian hotels (where breakfast is often a perfunctory affair of bread, jam and coffee in pretty small quantities): this offered fair coffee and good espresso; lots of nice croissants and rolls; a reasonable if repetitive 'international breakfast' of scrambled egg, bacon and sausage.

Reviews.Title: “How good do you want it junior suite overlooking the grand canal in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: deepsapphyr
Reviews.Content: Arrived with a riva water taxi, upon checking and having booked a standard room, they kindly informed me they upgraded me to a junior suite overlooking the grand canal, reception was very very good, front office dressed so smart transporting you back in time, rooms massive bathrooms full marble with jacuzzi, staff super diligent, breakfast excellent as well, I would so come here again with a beloved by my side!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cojusna
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect.Staff is very helpful.Breakfast is very poor.Nothing to eat at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Izzet Z
Reviews.Content: Right on the grand canal makes this hotel easily reachable by water taxi, alilaguba and vaporette. Friendly staff. Free room upgrade during our 2 nights. Good breakfast. Nothing to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovingagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its views and location and werenâ€™t disappointed. After being picked up by private water taxi, and dropped at the hotel's private pier; it was a very smooth transition from train to front desk. Check-in was professional and uncomplicated and we were directed to a lovely suite with a two person balcony. The view was everything I'd hoped for; both directions of the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge. Just fabulous. The room was clean, quiet and spacious with deep red wall paper and a comfortable seating area. It also had a king-sized bed and a roomy bathroom with all amenities. The ambience was very welcoming and with our beautiful views we felt like royalty. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and although the selection was small, it was very tasty and the coffee was good and hot. We were able to use the computer in the downstairs sitting room for quick emails to friends, and every member of the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The hotel is close to many good restaurants as well as the Piazza San Marco from where a lot of tours leave. Thereâ€™s also a vaporetto stop right outside, but we noticed the water bus was always very crowded so we just walked everywhere. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, with my only reservation being the shower over the bath; it might be a little difficult for the elderly.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet & comfy :)”
Reviews.Author: SeikoBlinky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very relaxing and peaceful but not too far from the famous St.Marco square. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We recommend room 216.....spacious and the most beautiful view! The only downside is breakfast....it could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel directly on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: ppg9711
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights post cruise. It was a fantastic choice. Excellent, scenic and convenient, location. Very friendly and informative front desk staff, bellmen and breakfast wait staff. We had the 2nd floor suite at the front of the hotel (#216) with a step out balcony directly overlooking the Grand Canal. The photos we took from the balcony looked like a postcard. . When I booked the suite I did not realize the "balcony" was only a "step out" and not a sittable balcony. It is step out type that is common in Venice. Although it was deltightful to stand on the balcony at night and observe the activity on the Grand Canal, I am not sure I would pay the added cost for this particular suite again. The entry level of the hotel had a few tables and chairs that also permitted enjoyable viewing of the Grand Canal. We would definitely stay at this hotel again if re-visiting Venice, but would probably opt for a less expensive room. The hotel arranged private transfers from cruise port to hotel and from hotel to airport. These transfers were a combination of private water taxi and limo. Although pricey, they were first class in both equipment and service and I would not hesitate to use this service again regardless of cost. Breakfast had varied selections and was very good The hotel is steps away from a Vaporetto station. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wendys2316
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on fellow trip advisor reviews and was very happy. Our room faced the Grand Canal. It was clean, very quiet and looked just like the pictures. Staff was very helpful in booking dinner and water taxis. They also arranged a tour of Venice for me via email prior to my arrival. The only downside is the buffet breakfast. The eggs were a bit runny and the bacon undercooked for my tastes. Instead, I had fruit and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “SWEET LOCATION...SWEET STAFF....LOVELY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Ellen K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the BEST locations in Venice...right on the Grand Canal..with a vaparetto stop 30 feet from the entrance. You will be near the Academia section of Venice with wonderful cafes and restaurants. The staff is warm, helpful and kind. They treated us like we were the only guests at the hotel. The rooms are lovely..the bathroom had double sinks with a great shower/bath combo. The breakfast was adequate. This is a small hotel..two floors...part of the Small Luxury Hotels of the World.... The only drawback for us was the price...440 euros per night...that is over the top..but since we were only in Venice for one day...we splurged. Everything about this hotel is tasteful....treat yourself to at least one night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small luxury hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ladym950
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 booked three rooms, one Jr suite overlooking the canal, and 2 deluxe rooms. One deluxe room must have been upgraded to a Jr. suite, because it turned out to be huge, with a separate sitting room and large bath. Our Canal View Jr. Suite exceeded my expectations - beautifully furnished, spacious, large bath and even a large walk in closet - and of course the fantastic view. Each room was very clean, lavishly furnished in classic Italian style, and felt luxurious. Beds were comfy & everyone slept well. The common areas were beautifully furnished and sparkling clean. Service was always very professional and courteous. We were traveling with my 80 year old father with limited mobility, and the desk staff arranged for a wheelchair rental and wheelchair assistance at the train station. The staff emailed me several times in advance to keep me updated on availability and cost of the rental, and provided a confirmation number for assistance at the train station. I should add, this was a rather last minute request 2 days prior to arrival. Upon our arrival, the wheelchair was waiting and it made all the difference in my father's ability to experience Venice. The location is great, close to good restaurants and easy walking distance to Rialto and Piazza San Marco. For us, having the convenience of a water bus stop next to the hotel was a huge plus. Not to mention the private water taxi dock at the hotel door step. The outdoor seating on the canal is a splendid way to enjoy an evening glass of wine or morning coffee while watching the canal go by. People cram the overpriced bad restaurants on the canal for this experience, and it is all yours in peace and quiet. My family was very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: maxV70
Reviews.Content: We spent two days and one night. This was the 2nd time I stayed here. First time was 5 years ago, when it was only a couple of years after renovation. Naturally, the rooms are not glistening now as they did back then. But they are still in a very good condition. The thing I like most - is red/gold tapestry on the walls. They give a real feel of chic and insulate sound perfectly. Bathrooms differ in size, but all of them are quite spacious and decorated nicely. The water pressure is not consistent thought, so while taking a shower you have to adjust hot/cold from time to time. We stayed there with kids in 2 interconnecting rooms. The bigger one had a very big bathroom and and alcove where a 3rd bed was placed. The smaller one was adequate enough, the only drawback being lack of wardrobe - just open space in the corridor with hanger rails and shelves. Though I didn't find this as a problem. 5 years ago we stayed in the Junior suite overlooking Canal Grande, I highly recommend it! Minuses: breakfast is pretty simple, choice is quite limited. The waitresses that particular morning were a bit slow and not extremely polite. However, maybe we just got unlucky with the shift.... Pluses: Location! on top of having its own berth on Canal Grande, it is 30 meters form the Palazzo Sant'Angelo bus stop (navetta) So it's very convenient! and it 10 min walking distance form Piazza San Marco. It's cosy, with a certain chic in the lobby and rooms, the view on Canal is spectaclular. Pricing is reasonable as well. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I imagined and more”
Reviews.Author: Kris M
Reviews.Content: My dream of sipping a glass of wine on the balcony of my hotel overlooking the Grand Canal in Venice came true. After a long day of travel we arrived to a very warm welcome and were amazed by our luxurious suite with the fantastic view from the balcony to the Rialto Bridge. The beautiful marble bathroom was huge and we felt like royalty. The room was very large and the decor absolutely amazing. Very cosy, comfortable and luxurious. The staff were always helpful and very accommodating. This was the perfect Hotel to stay in whilst in Venice and we look forward to coming back to Venice and the Palazzo Sant ' Angelo.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Formax
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed here and when we next come to Venice this will be our first choice. Excellent, luxurious hotel in a quiet position overlooking the Grand Canal and near the Rialto bridge. Very comfortable rooms and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: SouthJerseyTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a basic room...no view, but we were impressed with the size and classic Venetian decor. Small tables out front on the canal are perfect for coffee in the morning and wine in the evening...no bugs in April. Service was very good. Great location...enjoyed the breakfast. Wifi is extra here, but you get what you pay for....connections were flawless. Would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, ethereal location”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveller5
Reviews.Content: At the end of a two-week trip to Italy, we traveled to Venice. We were tired from our travels, hot from the train ride, and wishing we were headed back home instead of to another city. And then we arrived in Venice, and took a water taxi to the Palazzo Sant'Angelo sul Canal Grande, and decided we wouldn't have missed it for the world. Our family of five had a suite overlooking the Grand Canal for my husband and me, and an adjoining room for our three sons. The furnishings were exquisite ... silk wallcoverings and draperies, antiques, gorgeous marble bathroom ... but were clearly outshone by the views from our standing balconies over the Grand Canal. It was wonderful to be able to watch the vaporettos and water taxis and gondolas and "fire-engine" boats go by. Service was impeccable, particularly at the bar, where we enjoyed both aperitifs and nightcaps, before and after venturing out and walking all around Venice. We could not have asked for a better hotel for the end of our trip, and certainly look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff and location; great trip to get engaged”
Reviews.Author: Sunburnt_Penguin
Reviews.Content: Most of the staff at this boutique hotel were lovely, from the cleaners to the receptionists. Our room had a side view of a canal (although not the Grand Canal), although the room was sizeable, and the bed was super super large. The room was so lovely that I didn't mind overly much staying in there bed bound for almost a day and a half from being sick. (to that note, it was worth noting it costs 150 to call the hotel's doctor, so I decided to stick with a packet of imodium). One thing that we didn't like overly much was they didn't do a dinner service, and that there was no soup (only sandwiches, burgers and salads) on their room service menu, so I had to venture out of the hotel to a restaurant when I was ill. The area was really quiet at night, although Venice isn't really the place for drunken revelry. It only takes 3 minutes to walk to a lovely square for dinner (there is a SUPERB fish restaurant there, with a really nice propriertor. Heads and shoulders above other restaurants we went to, including The Cip.), and 10 minutes to St Marco (depending on how many tourists you have to butt past to get there). In terms of what freebies you get: bottle of prosecco (on 1st day). Bath stuff: shampoo, body lotion, body wash, shoe shine, vanity set, shower cap, special wash with bidet. Chocolates on pillows (cleaner comes twice a day).... All quite standard, but I find myself umming and ahhing about what toiletries I should take. Internet is not free, but it's relatively fast (although it crashed a few times). We purchased a 3 hour card for 7E, but you can go downstairs for a 24h topup (which is free). Examples of costs: Water taxi from Marco Polo airport: 100E Water taxi to Marco Polo airport (booked from hotel): 110E Water taxi to and from Murano: FREE when booked from the hotel. But you need to go on a tour. We bought some glasses but thought it was worthwhile. Bottle of beer: around 8.50E from minibar, and additional 50c or so in the bar downstairs. We paid 400E per night for our room, but booked on hotels.com with cashback on quidco.

Reviews.Title: “Arriving in Venice in style”
Reviews.Author: cloud_dem
Reviews.Content: We arrived by water taxi from the airport and were driven down the side canals then under the Rialto Bridge to the private pier of Palazzo Sant'Angelo. Beautiful hotel, very dramatic decour. Our bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom! The reception staff were very happy and helpful as were the breakfast staff. The location was fabulous, right on top of the vaporetta stop which made accessing everywhere incredibly easy and enjoyable. It was an incredibly hot few days we had but the hotel had fantastir air con as did the bedrooms. We would definately stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend, not the cheapest hotel in Venice but if you're going for a special occasion and want a 'wow' factor arrival and hotel this is it! The private water taxi from the airport is also a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfectly situated on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: brubakpl
Reviews.Content: We reserved a suite with Grand Canal view and so glad we did. Our room had an incredible view of the Rialto Bridge to our right and beautiful old buildings all around. Despite the activity nearby, the room was mostly soundproof. The room and marble bathroom felt luxurious and the staff was very friendly and spoke good English. The only negative was the breakfast was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Debsanne
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Beautifully appointed rooms and bathrooms. Stylishly decorated throughout. Within walking distance of all places we visited. Made our stay in Venice just perfect - would love to go back Overall highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the canal”
Reviews.Author: luvtotraveljw
Reviews.Content: First of all let me preface this review by saying that I'm a bit particular when it comes to hotels. I was particularly worried about hotels in Venice. I had heard that hotel rooms are very small, tend to be dark and sometimes smell musty because of the canal. This was not the case with Palazzo Sant'Angelo. I had a suite facing the canal with a view that was spectacular. The room was very comfortable, impeccably clean and amazingly large. The only thing that you need to be aware of is that they don't provide irons. I found this to be true of most hotels in Italy which is a bit frustrating. The hotels told me it was because they are fire hazzards but were more than willing to press things for you for a sizable fee. I think it's just another way for Italian hotels to generate more revenue. The hotel provides a very nice breakfast, not just croissants and coffee. They offered different types of bread, cold cuts, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, fruit, eggs, bacon, pastries, juices, coffee and tea. Their small dining room is very quaint, charming and tastefully appointed. They also have a small bar facing the canal that has appetizers during happy hour. There are several restaurants very close to the hotel although I was not impressed with the food in Venice. I had often heard that they had amazing sea food. While I loved Venice, I have had much better sea food in the states.......and much more reasonable as well. The location of this hotel is very convenient. It's only a few stops from the train station. 6.50 Euros per person on a Vaporetto or 120 Euros for a private water taxi. If you opt to take the Vaporettos, try to get into Venice as early as possible. I can't stress this enough. The Vaporettos become so crowded and it's difficult to get out of them (let alone with luggage) because of the number of people in them. We actually got stuck because we could not get to the exit fast enough and had to travel to the next stop and return. If it's one thing you learn traveling on these Vaporettos is that you have to be pushy! Last, make sure to take mosquito repellant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! A great hotel with a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: birddog82
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about this hotel. It is spacious and conveniently located near the San Angelo water bus stop. The staff is very helpful and went out of their way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. The interior is gorgeous and well maintained and the breakfast is delicious. From the hotel you can walk to San Marco, the Rialto, anywhere you need to go. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Sant'Angelo was everything we wanted in a Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PSalemSutton
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. Again and again I am a firm believer in a convienient, safe location. The rooms were as beautiful as the photos. We got upgraded to a jr. suite, and the service was superb. Traveling from the airport to the hotel was very easy. Just got the orange line valporetto right to the hotel. About a one hour ride. The room was ready ahead of time and we were able to do plenty of sight seeing our first day in Venice. I would recommend this hotel highly. If I were to say one negative thing it would be about the electricity in the room. The light switch and television switch was a little tricky to get used to. Always bring adapters for electrical appliances with you when traveling abroad.

Reviews.Title: “great service, impeccably clean, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: robg9000
Reviews.Content: I wish we had more time in Venice and at this nice property. After being in Rome for five nights it was relaxing to go to Venice with it's quaint streets, relative lack of crowds, colorful buildings and fine shops. The hotel itself is several hundred yards from the Rialto bridge and far enough from the square that you are in a nice quiet part of the city filled with residents and a few tourists. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite so I can't really comment on the value of the room we had reserved but the suite was fantastic. My only complaint about the place is the bar - it's such a terribly poor decision to gouge customers for a cocktail as much as they do. So we ended up buying one drink during our stay and buying a bottle of gin from a store a five minutes walk away. I mean it was nearly $20 US for a gin and tonic which is completely outlandish and in fact quite off putting. As such, there was rarely anyone sitting in their bar - a nice space gone to waste because of rip off prices. The breakfast was great by the way and they make a nice latte. I would definately stay here again. We took the complimentary water taxi ride over to a glass factory tour which was worth doing - some beautiful works that you will not see in the shops. They pick you up at the hotel but drop you off at St Mark's. If you decide to stay here, there is the Sant Angelo stop just feet from the hotel lobby on the water taxi route - it takes about 20 minutes from the train station - this should be in their location info on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - top notch service, food - little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: DaveMaharaj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with top notch service, the breakfast was great but the location was a little far from the main areas of venice and the rail station although if you pony up about 30 euro, you could get a gondala ride from anyway in venice to the doorstep of the hotel. recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing less than exquisite”
Reviews.Author: Caveman1000
Reviews.Content: Clearly a gorgeous hotel and in an incredible location. The rates are not cheap, but our stay was flawless. The staff was always attentive, very helpful, and saw to our every need. I miss our time there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: afonsopatrao
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, amazing bedroom, outstanding location. The only thing that could be verter is breakfast service. The palace is surreal. A dream hotel In a dream city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: bevb05
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, very comfortable, lovely little touches such as a chocolate on your pillow at night with the next day's weather forecast on a card. Everything you could possibly need including slippers for poor aching feet! Only negative point about our room the view from the windows wasn't very nice, I think we were at the rear of hotel, front rooms must have had a wonderful view of the Grand Canal. Also the very close building opposite was being renovated and building started about 6am waking us each day. The staff were very friendly and helpful,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic..........”
Reviews.Author: RichardB53
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice after taking my wife for her 50th birthday and we both have had the most fantastic experience. This hotel is the 'business', cannot fault it in anyway and we only had a standard room. The staff put the 'service' into customer service and are all first rate - even the concierge who greeted us with 'good morning', no matter what time of day it was !! Return to your room at night to find it 'prepared for bed', chocolate on pillow and a weather forecast for the following day. I would go back tomorrow without any hesitation. Bucks Fizz., bacon, scrambled egg and chorizo for breakfast, what more do you want ? Would have liked to use the hotel bar and sat outside (even though it was Feb / March), it is the Grand Canal that's 6 feet away after all, but whilst Venice isn't the cheapest place overall, I did baulk at the 10euros for a bottle of Heineken in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room with a priceless view of the canal.”
Reviews.Author: cchan_au
Reviews.Content: My favourite stop during our holiday was Venice. This was due in large part to our stay at the Palazzo. I booked a standard room, but we were upgraded to a canal room suite. The view from our room was priceless. It was the most beautiful hotel room I have ever stayed at. It made us look forward to going back to the hotel each day after a tiring day of sight seeing. The staff were efficient and friendly, with special mention to Manuela. Her restaurant recommendations were excellent. We loved the food, and we had our best meals during our entire trip around Italy. The staff also assisted us in checking-in online and printing our boarding passes. They advised us of a pending demonstration on our day of departure, and helped us plan our trip to the airport. They even prepared a breakfast pack for us, due to our very early departure. All the good things you read about the hotel is true.

Reviews.Title: “A snug gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JHS_Boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over Christmas, 2010, in a double and a triple. The hotel was lovely, snug and warm and welcoming. This was especially important since the cold, driving rain was not so nice, but the umbrella supply was plentiful. The beds were mostly comfortable, although the couch that turned into a bed in the triple room was not too good for the back. The bathrooms were gorgeous. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy, and the staff was uniformly delightful. My only suggestion is that it would have been nice if the bar in the hotel had served better (more varied) food at a more reasonable price. It forced us out of the hotel in search of food, which would normally have been just fine, but the cold and rain made us want to stay warm and dry. It's a great location and a gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: HeatherH71
Reviews.Content: This is a truly beautiful hotel - not cheap, although we got a great deal off-season. The staff is very friendly and helpful in arranging water taxis and helping you get your bearings. Venice is more difficult to navigate than some other cities, although this hotel's location on the Grand Canal makes it a bit easier - just remember to stay close to the Canal. The rooms were plush and beautiful and the jacuzzi is a relaxing way to end the day. While the vaporetto (public water transportation) is the cheapest to get around (it is the #1 line and the stop is Sant Angelo), it is quite jarring to deal with as your first impression of Venice, especially if you have luggage. I would recommend taking a private water taxi instead (50 euro from train station) if you want a stress-free arrival and departure.

Reviews.Title: “A real find for lovers of Venice”
Reviews.Author: rweis53
Reviews.Content: We booked Palazzo Sant'Angelo on the basis of tripadvisor reviews after a stay at the Palazzo Bauer two years ago. What a find Palazzo Sant'Angelo was, a delightful, exquisitely elegant place right in the heart of the Canal Grande. We had a glorious view across the canal and up towards the Rialto. We loved the discreet elegance of the hotel, the flawless courtesy and helpfulness of the staff. The concierge and his colleagues became instant friends and were able to book us into lunch at Ciprianis on Torcello. And they too found us the schedules for transport which we found printed out for us within minutes of asking. This is a must for all lovers of Venice who want to spoil themselves for a long week-end. Not cheap of course but quality usually comes at a price; certainly in Venice it does. The bar is a treasure: don't forget to sit there after a show and relax almost at water level with the Canal, waited on with the utmost discretion by Bobby (?) and his colleague while watching the gondolas drift by. A shame the gorgeous bar area is not used more. We felt a real wrench as we left and fervently hope to return to Palazzo Sant'Angelo next year. RenÃ© Weis London

Reviews.Title: “Very special place”
Reviews.Author: hetha
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here after running marathon. Loved everything about the hotel: location on bank of Grand Canal; vaporetto stop outside door (including Alilaguna direct to Marco Polo airport); tables and chairs on side of canal; very spaciosr and luxurious room with jacuzzi bath, robes and slippers; good quality breakfast; staff helpfulness. Only slight down side was that it is quite difficult to get to on foot from St Marks - got lost even with map but really added to experience as we saw different little squares etc. Would highly recommend for a night of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to all”
Reviews.Author: bertnI
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel right on the grand canal and only a few steps to the water taxi dock. Rooms are roomy and nice, staff is very helpful, inclluded breakfast very good. You can walk to everything from here and the staff can arrange private water taxi's to other locations. If you are flying in, take the public transit water taxi (13 euros each) from the airport to the hotel. Loads of restaurants and bars within a ten minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Rain in Venice can make this nice hotel seem far from the centre.”
Reviews.Author: coubaril
Reviews.Content: We found out during a two day post-cruise here that rain in Venice is both frequent and very frustrating. When the weather is awful a walk to St. Mark's can seem much longer than the normal 15 minutes! The hotel itself is beautifully furnished but our room lacked ( as so often is the case ) the drawers necessary to unpack properly so we lived in our suitcases. A sad omission! Having a landing stage of its own is a great plus as lugging suitcases around Venice is no fun! We found the hotel quiet and sleep comes easily. The staff overall were extremely helpful however it had no restaurant, just a breakfast room where that very ordinary meal was served. So dinner meant getting out the umbrellas and walking ! But we did find a gem of a restaurant, with the help of the hotel, " A Beccafico" just a five minute walk away in a nearby square. Don't miss this one - it was great value for wonderful food. So the San Angelo is worth a visit despite it's being very over-priced like all central Venice hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HarryB_Ottawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but then this is Venice, the city where we paid 20 â‚¬ for two cappuccini at the edge of St. Mark' square! Had a beautiful room for the first two nights of our honeymoon overlooking the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hote, Wonderful Staff, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen11000
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel.The staff was perfect, the room quite comfortable-fresh fruit and candy . Elegant breakfast area with sumptuous selection of cheese, meats, pastry and fruits. Very near to San Marco the Academia, restaurants and shopping. This place was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: MEU15
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Sant'Angelo sul Canal Grande is a wonderful hotel for couples. We had excellent service and a fantastic room. The bed was ultra comfortable. Sevice was excellent with breakfast in the morning included in the room rate. Beautifully decorated room and common room areas and bar. Really 5 star! Superbe service, very, very helpful staff. Highly recommend this hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service”
Reviews.Author: Live_t0_h0liday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights which we felt was just the right amount of time for us in Venice. Right on the Grand Canal and only metres away from the public water taxi service, Palazzo Sant'Angelo provided a great base for us to discover Venice. While the water taxi service was at your door-step, Venice is small enough to get around everywhere on your own two feet. For those catching the water taxi, consider getting a multi-hour (eg 24 hours) as it will likely be cheaper. All the staff at the reception and breakfast room was very friendly and professional. Complimentary breakfast while small was adequate with a selection of pastries, eggs and fruit. The room was small but clean. The hotel also offers a complimentary boat transfer to Murano where you can check out some original Venetian glass. The factory gives you a demonstration and tour around their facility. After your purchase (not compulsory but we bought some as we felt bad to leave without spending any $$) they organise a complimentary transfer back to a location of your choice. We found this a good way to not only see Murano but to check out the scenery along the way. A much more cost effective way to see Venice than the touristy gondola rides!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great find in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lnmsdad
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd stay, both outstanding. Lovely room (upgraded) overlooking Grand Canal. Helpful staff. Convenient location, away from Piazza San Marco but within walking distance. Absence of a full restaurant is only a modest inconvenience. If only there were fewer people in Venice in August (but unfortunately that's when our cruise left).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot for 40th Anniversary Trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: jfs0529
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to Venice in 23 years, and I arranged a trip to Italy that started in Siena to see the Palio. That was a dream of mine, so we continued on by train to Venice, and got the surprise of my life when we entered our room. We had been upgraded to a suite right on the canal (Room 116, I believe). Three small balconies overlooking the canal, marble bathroom, a large living area, and and a very comfortable bed. What a view to awaken to in the morning! To me, the allure of this small boutique hotel is the location, the impeccable staff, and the ambiance. There is a small bar here (no restaurant, but unnecessary in Venice), and you can have drinks at tables in front of the hotel in early evening. Breakfast was just OK, in a very small breakfast room. Internet is not great in all of Italy, and I used 'Venice Connected while in Venice'. The problem with them is that you really need to be almost on the canal to open up. In our room, I needed to put a chair by the balcony to keep a connection. In all, this hotel was a perfect stop for us in Venice for location, ambiance, and a view that can't be beat. We would love to come back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Hambagahle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sant'Angelo for two nights during the weekend of the "Regatta Storica" - the boat races on the Grand Canal. We chose the hotel based on the recommendation of a friend who had invited us to a party to view the races from her roof terrace nearby. We were delighted with our choice. The hotel is not cheap - by Swiss standards it is quite pricey for a 4 star, but then this is Venice (!) and its location right on the Grand Canal is wonderful. I reserved a Junior Suite and asked for a quiet room. We had a small suite - separate bedroom and sitting room - at the back of the hotel looking down onto a little garden and one of the "calle". It was totally quiet. Just perfect! The room was nicely furnished, spotlessly clean and had a nice bathroom with Jacuzzi. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, and made us feel at home. The welcome drink and snacks was lovely, as was the bottle of wine we found in our room. The AC worked perfectly and we were able to adjust it to our needs. The hotel does not have a restaurant - there is a breakfast room (a bit small) and a breakfast buffet, which is adequate, was included in the room rate. I personally do not think you can get good bread in Italy, but the rolls on the buffet came close. We asked for black coffee and were served "caffÃ© americano" which we really do not like. I then asked for espresso doppio and they were brought promptly and with a smile. I heard someone order boiled eggs, but for us the scrambled eggs and bacon and sausages on the buffet were more than enough. Because there was no restaurant we looked around the area for somewhere to have a light lunch and found the Ristorante S. Stefano on the Campo S. Stefano, close to the hotel. I had a fantastic grilled Branzino, served with potatoes and olives. I recommend this little place for meals if one is staying at the Sant'Angelo and doesn't really want to go very far away. I should also add as a tip - if you drive to venice and therefore must park your car, reserve a place in advance at the Tronchetto parking garage, at the entrance to Venice. You can reserve a VIP place, which is guarded and locked. On arrival you are taken to your place, and you can lock your car. It is really very safe. The cost was EUR 30 for 24 hours which we thought was reasonable for the care taken. From there you can take vaporetto line 2 into the centre of Venice (EUR6.50 pp) OR take a water taxi for EUR 60. Great place! I hope we can return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: LacEdge
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully big room for European standards. Closet space for luggage. Marble in bathoom.... standard in Italy acutally. Free drink and snacks (Recommend Bellini). Comes with potatoe chips, unforgetable olives, and peanuts. Service was impeciable, nice, friendly,.... etc.... Would stay hera again in a heartbeat. Very easy to find with public water transportation bus authough we walk to save the money. Remcommend public transportation in hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel on the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: theatremom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our choice for 3 nights. Our room was elegant and looked exactly as shown on the hotel's website. The beds were very comfortable, and the air conditioning was wonderfully quiet. Our bathroom had a jacuzzi tub. The shower worked very well too. We had plenty of towels, and the maid serviced the room twice each day. The breakfast each morning was delicious--fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, croissants, rolls, cereals, cheese, ham, small sausages, bacon, fresh orange juice, wonderful coffee or espresso. The entire hotel staff went above and beyond in helpfulness and cheerfulness. There is also a daily happy hour for 12 euros in the bar. The water bus stop is right in front of the hotel, and that is a real bonus! The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to the Basilica of San Marco, and the walk to the Rialto is about 10 minutes. The only criticism I have regarding the hotel is the expensive charge for wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeacherITE
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Sant'Angelo sul Canal Grande was beautiful and everything you could want in Venice! Steps away from the Vaporetto "Water Bus" number 1 line stop, which is a must do in Venice and the best way to arrive at all of the popular attractions... Plus, Door to Door service from the airport or cruise terminal by water taxi. No dragging of suitcases or lots of tourist noise at this gem of a hotel but yet in the heart of Venice. Sitting at night with a glass of wine on the Grande Canal was amazing and so relaxing after a busy day. Our accommodations were decorated attractively and had every luxury imaginable. The inclusive breakfast buffet was delicious and elegantly presented. My husband & I would highly recommend this wonderful Small Luxury Hotel. A perfect beginning for our Seabourn Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky23EppingEssex
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in Venice. Having travelled to Venice on the Orient express and been treated to 2 days of sheer luxury with the very best in service, we felt it would be virtually impossible to maintain such a high standard. However from the moment we arrived at this hotel we were met with exactly that. Our room on the 1st floor had a side canal view and was beautifully decorated, ,spotlessly clean and with a luxurious, spacious bathroom that really had the WOW factor. Staff are very welcoming and helpful, right down to loading our bags onto the water taxi for us when we left. We will definately be returning here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice - great location, great room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely terrific. The staff was very friendly, the view was amazing, and the location was perfect. The hotel is right at a vaparetto stop, so it's virtually impossible to get lost, and it is very easy to get to and from the train station without breaking the bank (absent a vaparetto strike). The location is absolutely perfect in other ways as well - in a quiet part of the grand canal, and yet a nice, short walk to Piazza San Marco or Rialto area. The rooms are sumptuously decorated, although I must say that you HAVE to get a room with a vew of the grand canal to fully appreciate this property. The breakfast, which was included, was perfect. Just enough choices without a huge buffet. While we stayed at beautiful properties in other parts of Italy, this was my favorite hotel. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location - fabulous rooms”
Reviews.Author: MontiNb
Reviews.Content: We had booked a double deluxe room and were upgraded to a Grand Canal view suite with 2 balconies. The suite was absolutely amazing and the views just fabulous. Always something to watch from the balconies overlooking the Grand Canal. The room was very plush with a separate lounge area, bedroom and bathroom. All very roomy and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was good and the front desk staff pleasant and helpful making great recommendations for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: CecilyWiltshire
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is brilliantly positioned, extremely clean and the staff are wonderfully friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled with our choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: mccully
Reviews.Content: Excellent location being a minute from a vaporetto stop Wonderful to sit by the Grand canal and enjoy an early evening drink Fantastic breakfasts Very quiet, comfortable room Luxurious bathroom - the only improvement I could suggest would be better hair dryers.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Thordrop
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, warm welcome. Always attentive and quick service. Small, intimate and quiet hotel. Large, comfortable room in plush Venetian style. Marvellous bathroom. All the amenities. Bed a bit hard and some noise from the boats on the Grand Canal in the morning (vaporetto-landing just outside) - but the turn-down service with a small chocolate and the weatherforecast for the next day om the pillow almost made up for that. No WiFi in the room. Wonderful breakfast in small, intimate breakfastroom. Nice bar and lounge with fresh newspapers and splendid views of the Grand Canal. Very good location 10 meters from vaporetto/boat landing, with service directly to the airport (you reach the airport in 1 hour, hourly service). Short walking distance to both Rialto and San Marco (5 min's both) and the vaporetto to other parts of town. Liked best: small, luxurious hotell in good location with friendly staff. Missed WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: aquilasicula
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 weeks ago with beautiful mild weather. The hotel is in typical venetian style, classical and elegant. The staff are very friendly and help you out with tips and suggestions. The location is the best; right on the Canal Grande - try to get a room with the canal view- at 5 minutes to San Marco square and Rialto bridge. The breakfast is served in a small cozy room, it could be better it is limited but with top quality items and excellent espresso coffee. The quiet rooms are well maintened, elegant and very confortable, of a big size for me. I think the prices they have are right, it is an unbeatable value for Venice, the most incredible city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtakingly beautiful location - hassle free arrival and departure via private pontoon”
Reviews.Author: LizzieGAustralia
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Sant'Angelo is probably the most beautiful hotel we stayed in in Europe. The decor and the location are both stunning. We had read many travellers reviews of the downside of staying in Venice, about the pain of having to drag suitcases up and down steps and across bridges and difficulty in locating their hotels. Not so at Palazzo Sant'Angelo. We had a water taxi take us from the train station directly to a private pontoon on the grande canal directly in front of the hotels main entrance. It is so worth it and the water taxis are gorgeous sleek timber panelled boats with leather upholstery and a wonderful experience. We were there with our 2 teenagers in adjoining rooms #s 208 & 210 and it was very spacious. Our windows directly over looked a side canal and had a great view of the grand canal. Walking to Piazza San Marco was a delightful 10 minutes away and gives you a chance to get a feel for the place. The other bonus is that the hotel is right next to the Sant'Angelo vaporetti stop (ferry stop) which makes getting around very easy. My only complaint is very minor - for 220 euros per room per night we would have expected free WiFi but you had to pay for this service. This was not in keeping with other similar or maybe not quite as luxurious accommodation we had in other partsof Italy and France. The staff were warm, friendly and very helpful. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel with wonderful views of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Philip36
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at the Palazzo Sant Angelo in Venice and found it a delightful three days. Right next door to the Sant Angelo vaparetto stop it was ideally situated overlooking the grand Canal. We were upgraded (without asking) to a small suite with sitting room, lovely bedroom with huge bed and delightful bathroom with a #jacuzzi' bath. We never tired of standing on one of three balconies we had looking down at the view. Hotel staff were excellent and helpful. Breakfast room was small and cramped and staff seemed reluctant to clear away used dishes etc during breakfast. One word of warning - drinks at the hotel were expensive (as is the whole of Venice) and my partner and myself had two oranges and two gin and tonics one evening sitting on the small area infront of the hotel and the bill was 52 euros which, in my book, works out at about Â£46! However we were offered lots of little snacks with the drinks. All in al a lovely experience and a great place to stay. Venice is a sheer delight.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious boutique hotel on the Grand Canal.”
Reviews.Author: CCJE
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel after a terrific 3 night stay. Excellent location- easy access to the airport and the rest of Venice with the boat stops just outside. 10 minute walk to St Mark`s Square and less than 10 minutes walk to the Accademia Bridge. Very pleasant to walk anywhere from the hotel with quaint streets and canals. No crowds near hotel which would be quite a relief during the busy months. We were upgraded to a Junior Suite on arrival which was beautifully decorated with a huge marble bathroom. The room was immaculately clean and overlooked the side canal as well as having views of the grand canal when we stuck our heads out of the window. The huge double bed was very comfortable- but the sofa bed had a thinner mattress which was less comfy to lie on. Venice had not cooled down at night by the end of October so as the air-conditioning was set to heating mode the room felt slightly warm even when the heat was turned off- which meant that we had to open the window on 2 nights. Staff were very helpful - spoke good english and were always very obliging recommending some good restaurants. We found an excellent restaurant- Trattoria Casa Mia on Trip Advisor. It was a nice touch to have printed news sheets available in the lounge- for several countries. Breakfast was very good- lovely scrambled egg and delicious fruit salad. Fresh bread rolls and various filled croissants. Will come back to Venice soon and would definitely stay here. If you email the hotel, they will send you very detailed information about arriving at the hotel from the airport. We found the orange line boat bus to be ideal - less than an hour from the airport to the hotel and less crowded than the vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: HandyShandy
Reviews.Content: Venice is like being transported back into the sixteenth century. It conjures up images of canals, gondolas and masks and walking through the narrow streets it is easy to imagine Casanova coming round the corner in his long cloak and three-pointed hat. The hotel is perfectly situated. The Orange Line waterbus will take you from/to the airport for a very reasonable 13 euros per person (a water taxi will charge 95 euros) and the bus stop is right by the hotel so no shlepping suitcases along the busy narrow streets. The waterbuses are punctual: there are no traffic snarl-ups on the Grand Canal. Even so, everything in the San Marco district is within a 15 minute walk of the hotel. Special thanks to hotel receptionist Marco for being so thoughtful ! A tip for photography enthusiasts: the waterbus stops are floating piers that jut into the canal and provide an unobstructed view of the bridges and waterside palazzos.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room classic Venetian style location location”
Reviews.Author: Ray17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the August bank holiday weekend for 4 nights. We arrived in Venice via the airport from the uk and caught the public water taxi direct to a stop within 20 yards of the hotel. The cost for two was 50 euros return excellent service. The hotel has an excellent location, for touring the Venice area generally. The rialto bridge you can see from the hotel and St Marks square is within 15 minutes walk f. The hotel has a really good location on the grand canal in a quiet area. The room we were allocated was towards the rear of the hotel. It was large with a bedroom and separate seating area two tvs the bath had a Jacuzzi well impressed on the whole with the hotel. The exception was the breakfast if the hotel room was 5 star the breakfast certainly was not, very average. But that besides a great hotel . We did the usual tourist things we tried to visit Harry's Bar but were refused entry due to a dress code we were not aware. Had a great short stay but expensive or what? you just have to forget about it for the few days you are there. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation for 1 LOCATION 2 ROOMS. The other thing I should mention I found Venice on the whole very clean no smells shame about the graffiti

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location right on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: sailorsforever
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and location.Old world charm and ambiance.Twenty minute walk to St.Marks Square or take water taxi at front door.Room was on 4th floor back with elevator.No views but had king bed,bath with jacuzzi and separate shower.Not much in closet room for clothes.Bed turned down in evening with chocolate on pillow.Breakfast included but eggs were runny.Croissants were so good!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful again”
Reviews.Author: AntipodeanAbroad
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a little over a year ago and returned with my wife prior to commencing a med cruise. This time I splurged on a grand canal suite which while not cheap is worth every cent. Revisiting the scene of a past great experience is usually fraught with the peril of disappointment but not on this occasion. This hotel is in such a great location. So sonvenient to almost everywhere in Venice (even on foot-but easily using the vaporetto stop at the front door) but also so quiet. A drink at the bar or at a table on the embankment overlooking the grand canal in the late afternoon is simply fantastic. The service is good and the staff friendly and helpful. The rooms are perfectly decorated and the bathrooms a marble dream. Again I very highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFr0mFl0rida
Reviews.Content: The service was great, and the rooms were roomy and comfortable. I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: waterfall35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel fo 4 days in September 09 and found it to an excellent and very clean hotel. The location is brilliant, not up near the busy/touristy Rialto bridge area but all within walking distance. It is on the (airport water bus route) - the water bus stops within 10 meters of the hotel (great when you don't know where you are going and are lugging bags!) It is very quiet and pretty. I loved it and will go back there to stay with my Mum who is coming to visit me next year. The breakfast though is the only downside, it was very disappointing - the breads are frankly awful and not a good range available. It is not a cheap hotel so I think they should offer guests a lot better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Free upgrade and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: CaddyCK
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in Venice with my boyfriend, and was delighted to have found such an amazing hotel. We arrived very early, tired from our overnight travel and hot from the humid August weather, and was welcomed by a cool, air coniditioned hotel with the friendliest staff. The hotel wasn't fully booked, so they upgraded us to a Junior Suite, which was above and beyond my expectiations. The suite overlooked the Grand Canal and was incredibly romantic. My favorite thing about this hotel was the location. You are a bit away from St Marks, but everything is a short walk away in Venice so it really doesn't matter (although the narrow/winding streets are confusing). It is so quiet in this area because there aren't millions of tourists running around. The other bonus is that there is a water bus stop right outside the hotel, which makes getting to/from airport and train station very convenient. Some may say this hotel is a bit expensive.....but if u can splurge in one city, let it be Venice. You can save yourself a ton of money if you skip the gondola (130 euro an hour!!!!!!!) and take the water bus instead of the private water taxi from the airport (90 euro vs 13 euro). Breakfast was one of the nicer ones we had in Italy. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, falls down on details”
Reviews.Author: nigelanne
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a weekend at his hotel. It is in a great location in Venice and our room did have an amazing view of the Grande Canal, though at a high price. We were disappointed with the breakfast - the bread was very poor and the toaster the slowest I've come across. Mostly the staff were very helpful, especially those in the breakfast room. The thing that really grated with us was around internet access. We were keen to use the internet, mainly to check in and print boarding passes and were very shocked to be told that there was a charge of three euros per hour to do this. Given the high cost of the rooms, this gives such a poor impression. We found an internet cafe instead. The bar was very expensive and we would agree with previous comments that the 'nibbles' offered with drinks were poor quality. Overall we were disappointed, especially given the very high cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a great view of the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: deanie756
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on the Grand Canal with it`s own private jetty which is great when arriving by water taxi as you do not have to manage your cases up and down narrow streets and bridges.We had a small very quiet twin room with a courtyard view. The beds where comfortable with lovely soft fresh linen. Fab modern bathroom with hydro- bath which was great to revive you after a day of sightseeing. Excellent central location for all the main attractions. All the hotel staff where very professional and spoke excellent english. My only complaint would be that the rooms had no facility to make tea or coffee. Had a lovely 4 days here and we really enjoyed sitting out at the front on the hotel in the afternoon with a bottle of wine watching the world sail by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: hlmhrt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 1 night after our cruise ended in Venice. I would agree with the reviews on this site that the hotel has an excellent location. However we did experience one problem with the air conditioning. The room we had was on the 4th floor (room 47) and the air conditioning in this room didn't seem to be working. I reported this to the front desk and they responded that the hotel was full but they did bring a fan to the room which was appreciated. I would suggest you ask for a room on a lower floor. The hotel also has a happy hour from 5 to 8pm but the food that was put out was really just chips, cheese and a few vegetables. It was nothing elaborate and the drink prices in the bar were very high. We spend $30 for 2 drinks while visiting their bar during their happy hour. That seemed high even for Venice. I do agree the breakfast was good and the service was excellent. The hotel did book us a private taxi to the airport and was very helpful in answering our questions. Yes, I would probably stay here again but would make sure I'm not booked on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: flcrews
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Sant' Angelo hotel is situated directly on the Grand Canal, steps away from the Sant' Angelo vaporetto stop, and it also has it's own dock if you wish to hire a private water taxi. This is very important, because everywhere you go in Venice is by boat (vaporetto) and once you hit land, it's all on foot. So the last thing a weary traveler wants to do, is traverse narrow (but beautiful) vias and pathways with luggage in tow, as you try and find your Hotel. The staff was extremely professional, friendly and attentive and they all spoke excellent English. Stefano checked us in and set the tone for a wonderful stay. He was quite helpful, as was everyone we came in contact with. The room we were in was not on the water, but had a great view of a courtyard. Beautiful furnishings, a comfortable bed and a very large bath made our stay quite enjoyable. A great breakfast was included in our rate, but the location is adjacent to many fine restaurants, all within walking distance; including easy access to Saint Mark's, the Rialto and the Academia bridges. We don't think there's a better location; by day it offers stunning views of the Canal, and by night offers a gorgeous place to stroll. The rates were slightly expensive (but what isn't in Venice), but comparable to other four star hotels. However, with that price came remarkable value. When we return to Venice, and we will, we'll be staying here. Ciao.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kinginfl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really spectacular. The location is perfect. The staff did a remarkable job of making us feel like we were their only guests. The breakfast was tremendous. Great bar for a night cap. I really can't say much more that hasn't been said by other reviewers...this is really a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service, & Room”
Reviews.Author: EuroShiro
Reviews.Content: The front desk provided excellent service, answered all of our questions, and directed us to all of our requested locations, including a travel agent who booked our eurail reservations from venice to florence & florence to rome. The room was extremely clean and nicely decorated. air conditioning worked well. The bathroom was clean and spacious. the location of the hotel was so convenient, since it was right next to the sant'angelo stop and a water taxi took us directly to that stop for 13 euro. and the sant'angelo stop seems a lot quieter than the other stops (eg rialto). we would definitely stay at palazzo sant'angelo again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect,quiet,convenient location.great service”
Reviews.Author: suehope
Reviews.Content: Excellent,well informedand helpful front desk. Gorgeous , very clean room with fantastic view of Grand canal. Location was primo, vaporetto(public transportation) right outside the door. We were upgraded to a 2 room suite,nice sized sitting room plus bedroom. The bathroom was off the sitting room which is a better configuration. Breakfast was better then a standard continental. Absolutely a Top Elegant Small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply made our trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: jvachon
Reviews.Content: To begin, we booked a standard double room and were upgraded to a junior suite canal view so I'm sure my views are a little bit biased. But we had a look at a few other rooms at this hotel and talked to a number of guests and can safely say that our experience wasn't unique. We originally booked the Dei Dogi but were put off by some recent negative reviews and our concerns at its location. Best move we've made on our trip thus far. The Palazzo Sant Angelo is situated right on the Grand Canal, with a 10 minute walk to the Accademia Bridge and about a 5 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge. 15 minutes gets you to Saint Marks. And there's a vaporetto/Alilaguna stop right outside so getting in from the airport and around the city is a breeze. The staff are great (even discounting our upgrade) and the decor and design of the hotel are unmatched. Yes, the drinks are incredibly overpriced (but where aren't they in Venice??) and the wireless internet charges border on theft but when you take the whole package in it can't be beat. If you are lucky enough to get room 118 forget the hotel bar... go to the local deli and pick up some beers/wine and you'll have an even better view from your room than from the bar. We secretly enjoyed the jealous looks of the folks floating by on the frequent vaporettos. And our friends loved the pictures of the Rialto from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificant Venice hotel steps from the Santangelo waterbus dock!”
Reviews.Author: carolinaexplorer
Reviews.Content: Since it was our first time in Venice, I did not want us to have to drag our suitcases through the beautiful but winding streets trying to find our hotel. Palazzo Sant'Angelo is perfect in every way. Hop off the waterbus and enter the lovely hotel. They held our suitcases and directed us with a map to the Palazzo San Marco till afternoon when our room would be ready. Had a lovely afternoon and then was amazed at our beautifully appointed room. We had a suite because had 3 people so we did not face the canal, but no complaints at all. The breakfast at the hotel was amazing , the best we had in Italy. Service at the hotel is excellent. They directed us to outstanding restaurants and helped with transportation questions. We loved this hotel and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowtowntraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night while on a short visit to Venice. Everything was perfect. We were upgraded to a suite overlooking the Grand Canale with beautiful tapestry walls, a walk-in closet, huge marble bathroom. The hotel is close to transportation alternatives, a short walk to St Marks and Rialto, and has helpful and friendly staff. Our entire stay was excellent in every aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great staff, great service”
Reviews.Author: Amsyyy
Reviews.Content: Positives: Very friendly staff - nothing was too much trouble Beautiful rooms (ours was a suite overlookin the grand canal) Nice Breakfast Near Vaperetto stop (Sant Angelo) High 4 stars - leaning towards five. Perfect to an authentic italian experiance - very romantic and charming hotel Far away enough to get some peace and quite but only 10mins from Rialto if working Negatives: Slighlty pricey (6 euros for water) but consistent with Venice No iron in room (but we knew that before and took travel iron) Overall Great experience. if you want a personalised service from an italian style boutique hotel you will not be disappointed. If you want grand oppulance, the go to the Bauer or Cipriani. This hotel is perfect for a romantic break away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: scottyuf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Palazzo Sant'Angelo the last two days of our nine day Italian trip. The hotel is less than 50 yards from the Vaporetto Stop. Upon arrival our room wasn't ready so they said to go to Rialto for an hour and we will have it ready. When we returned we were upgraded to a luxury suite directly on the Grand Canal. The room was beautiful and so were the views from the balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. The room was a little pricey as well as the drinks from the mini bar (7Euro Coke) and the drinks from the bar the breakfast made up for it. Huge breakfast with eggs, bacon, pastries, yoguarts, and fresh fruits. We really enjoyed staying at the hotel and recommend it for those who don't mind paying the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great intro to Italy!”
Reviews.Author: EarningsGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. We loved our room, with a nice walk-in closet area and beautiful marble bathroom. The hotel is conveniently located to a Vaporetto / Alilaguna stop -- literally steps away. It is also convenient for walking to the Rialto area and Piazza San Marco. The staff was welcoming and nice. The breakfast buffet included a nice selection of fruit, yogurt / granola, and cooked food. The coffee and tea even come in beautiful, individual fine china pots. All in all, it was a great start to our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for discovering Venice”
Reviews.Author: Therealreviewer
Reviews.Content: Great central location right on Grand canal but in quiet location. Great for water transport stop right at the Hotel. When you see so many people dragging suit cases round venice you realise how handy this is. Spotless room. We were upgraded to a suite which was very nice although it didnt look onto the Canal so the view was well !, shame. Service was faultless on all counts. Only minus points were no Tea/Coffee in room (12.5 Euro for two coffee's), No ironing allowed in rooms so if you need the odd shirt ironing you need to use the pricey laundry service. Also as others have stated, drinks prices are crazy both in the Bar and minibars which makes you venture elsewhere which is also a shame. Expensive ( as is everything in Venice) but would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, friendly first-class service and good food.”
Reviews.Author: Yorktravellers
Reviews.Content: For the first time ever as seasoned travellers my wife and I feel compelled to write a review in respect of our recent visit to this magnificent hotel. This was our fourth visit to Venice and this time we travelled with two friends. We identified this hotel as offering superb deals at the time of our visit, checked out earlier reviews and then booked two luxury rooms with views to a side canal. We can only state that we were not disappointed and found accommodation, food and friendly service beyond our expectations. Its location on the Grand canal is superb - it has it's own private jetty for water taxis and is only 40 yards from Sant Angelo waterbus stop. It is close to all major sightseeing attractions and yet is also in a quiet location. Upon arrival at the hotel we were warmly greeted and enjoyed a complimentary bottle of "bubbly" served in our rooms. The rooms themselves were indeed luxurious and are truly represented on the hotel website. Our bed linen was changed daily and our towels changed twice per day! The inclusive buffet style breakfast catered for all tastes providing a substantial feast for those requiring it. The efficient reception staff spoke fluently in English and provided good advice whenever asked. The only negative comment I can offer is that both the drinks in the main bar and room mini bar were expensive to the British traveller. All in all a hotel to be highly recommended and well worth its place in the Small Luxury Hotels of the World Book.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: brill95
Reviews.Content: The reviews on TripAdvisor are so right - this is a gem of a hotel. It's small and wonderfully welcoming. The staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant. We went for a weekend to Venice and ended up staying an extra couple of days because all flights were cancelled because of the snow. Everyone from the front desk to the wonderful lady in the breakfast room and the really friendly bar tender could not have been friendlier. The hotel is situation in a wonderful location, right on the Grand Canal with a vaporetto stop right outside - so five mins to St Mark's Square and one stop to the Rialto. It's also the stop for the airport bus which costs only 13 euros one way, so the transport links could not be better! The rooms vary in size. One friend stayed in a standard room but even though it was small it was cozy and clean with a wonderful marble bathroom. We stayed in a junior suite overlooking the Grand Canal which was wonderful, fantastic views of the Rialto and the Grand Canal, very spacious with a wonderful bathroom. My only grouse was that the pillows were really hard ! There are so many hotels in Venice to choose from but this is one I would return to any time.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely lovely 40th birthday surprise for my husband”
Reviews.Author: SpunkyPumpkin
Reviews.Content: Had a very lovely stay at the San Angelo. Rooms somewhat on the smaller side, well, smaller than I had anticipated anyway, but still perfectly nice. Beautifully decorated, as was the entire hotel. The breakfast /dining room, is small, but had a very nice buffet style breakfast provided, both hot and cold, and suiting many nationalities. Staff extremely pleasant and helpful, Very happy to advise re dining out. Is also literally 20 paces from the vaporetto stop, which you only will fully appreciate once in Venice. The vaporetto stops are not as close together in places as you might anticipate. A little restaurante which we enjoyed greatly, was called the something adelaide, cant quite remember, but I'm sure you'd find it on google. Enjoy! Oh, also, we went at a perfect time of year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: RDandMD
Reviews.Content: I went there with my father for a 3 night 4 day break. The hotel was less than 50 metres from the autobus port on the grand canal. This meant we did not have to wheel our luggage through the streets of venice. The hotle was clean, our first room was so small that the next day I happened to mention it to the manager in passing. On our return, we were given a free upgrade. Th staff at the hotel were fantastic and even gave us abottle of champagne for any inconvenience caused to us regarding the room. The breakfast area is small but does provide an atmosphere typical of venice The only let down is that there is no hotel restaurant for dinner- but there are plenty of places to eat elsewhere. The walk to San marco square was 10 min. The guided tours advised by the hotel are well worth it and are not expensive at all. There are 2 supermarkets on the south side of the canal, find them and you will get some good priced food and drinks. Do the boat trip to the 3 islands- murano is worth it. On the whole, it was a good experience and the weather was fine 20-22c.

Reviews.Title: “All the rave reviews here are true”
Reviews.Author: alexkorf
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in a quiet but very central location. 10 meters or so from a vaporetto stop "S.Angelo" so very easy to get anywhere even if you don't feel like walking. The hotel itself and the rooms are perfectly maintained. We stayed at the deluxe double, and it was quite big by any standards. The staff is all smiles and helpfulness, the cleaning ladies don't come banging on your door at 6am and even the part-time breakfast waiters know what they are doing. Traveller's Choice award appears well-earned. If you're after traditional luxury, avoid the big names and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DavidSBrussels
Reviews.Content: Taking my mother to Venice for her first trip, we wanted a good location and reasonable comfort. We got both, and more, from the Palazzo Sant'Angelo. Last stop on the Water Bus from the airport, the Vaporetto stop is barely 20 yards from the hotel entrance. So no trudge to the hotel after a hard day's sightseeing. We found Front of House friendly although no upgrades were offered (or asked for). But our rooms were spacious and more than comfortable with views over courtyard and side canal. Full baths with jacuzzi - a real treat after a day's walking.
