No restaurant but that's not a problem in Venice and given the bar prices (â‚¬12 for a cocktail, â‚¬6 for a hot chocolate in 'Happy Hour') it's unlikely we would have eaten there. But the breakfast was fine, though the tables a little crowded, and there was a very comfortable lounge with up to date papers including IHT and FT. Staff were helpful. Early November was a great time to visit: fewer crowds, lower prices (low season) but lovely weather, at least for us. And now I have to start saving up for a room overlooking the Grand Canale (a mere â‚¬170 per night extra!).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: neriagechris
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. We decided to stay on the Grand Canal since we knew we would only be in Venice once. We thought the location might be noisy and it might have been, but our room was very quiet. The service at the front desk was excellent. The breakfast in the morning was very good. You could not be at a better place for transportation with the San Angelo vaperetto stop about 10 seconds away! No downside to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Sant'Angelo in September for 2 nights. We booked this hotel through the Small Luxury Hotel website and received a complimentary upgrade when we checked in. Our suite was amazing, decorated in the style you would expect from Venice. Gold and red walls, beautiful, large marble bathroom, huge closet. We also had a bottle of complimentary wine and cookies awaiting us. This hotel has a wonderful location. It is smack outside the St Angelo Vaparetto stop and 10 min walk to wherever you want to go in Venice. One afternoon, after a morning of exploring and getting lost, we sat outside the hotel on the canal and had our own little happy hour. They have complimentary snacks every day around 4 pm. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive, the room we had was large and clean (the bed was big but not so comfortable). My only minor complaint was the tiny TV (not a big deal we did not come to Venice to watch TV!). In retrospect, I wish I had spent more than 2 days in Venice, its a truly magical city and this hotel really helped make that experience.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in a perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: kazpalms
Reviews.Content: I took my two eldest sons with me to Venice towards the end of September as I love the place and wanted to show it to them so they would love it too! Selected the Palazzo Sant Angelo for its location and because of excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. They weren't wrong! The staff are all extremely courteous, helpful and professional and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. The location is perfect - right on the Grand Canal looking down towards the Rialto Bridge one way, and only a few steps from the vaporetto stop. We took two rooms - one twin and one double on the floor above. Both extremely clean and decorated quite traditionally in shades of red and gold. Very comfortable beds and well equipped rooms. The breakfast was not too much to write home about but no different from many other places I have stayed in Venice so can't complain. The coffee was good though. The staff directed us the Campo San Stefano which is a 5 minute walk behind the hotel and has three restaurants and a gelateria/cafe in it. It is a wonderful place to sit and eat or just enjoy a drink and/or an ice cream (my eldest son managed a total of 11 scoops over a two day period!). Weather was perfect and it was just like sitting in a film set - gorgeous. Venice did not disappoint, yet again and my sons came away very impressed not only by the place itself but also by the warmth of our welcome to this lovely hotel. Would certainly stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Give yourself a treat”
Reviews.Author: clarkio
Reviews.Content: having spent 3 days in a very stayed 4star hotel in Cortina we were looking forward to a luxury stay in venice. I choose the 4star Palazzo Sant Angelo Hotel for it's location right on the Grand Canel and only 20 yds from the sant angelo water bus stop. We were automatically up graded to a suite with newly decorated fabric wall coverings and matching furniture and carpets in a traditional style.The room was beautifuly clean and had high grade cotton bed linen on a queen size bed. the hotel has around 42 rooms and has only been open for 5 years having been totally refurbished. After breakfast we were met by the hotel manager Paolo Morra who enquired about our stay and wanted to know if every thing was satisfactory,which is was. At around 400 euros a night it,s not cheap but you get what you pay for - a very good hotel with very helpful polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Epicureanpenguin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo for three days (incl weekend). We absolutely loved the place, the views and the friendly staff. We were upgraded to a junior suite overlooking canal grande - amazing views to the canal and rialto bridge. The suite was spotless clean, the sheets/duvet soft, with sheets replaced daily. The SantAngelo vaporatto is 10 steps away and all the nice restaurants recommended by the hotel at walking distance. The hotel made the city even more enjoyable and is a perfect romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “I got engaged at the pier of this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: HopelessRomance
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of searching before I selected the Palazzo Sant'Angelo in Venice, Italy. I had a very elaborate plan to propose to my girlfriend (you can read about it at www.doyouthinkshesaidyes.com) and this hotel couldn't have been better. There is a woman concierge/front desk person who's name is ZOE who is AMAZING. Just great. This hotel sits right on the Grande Canal, a very short walk from Rialto Bridge and the sights. They upgraded us to a room that looks right onto the canal. Probably the best room in the house. The hotel itself only has 20 or so rooms so the service is very personable. I read on other reviews that the service was questionable, but I didn't see that in the people I encountered. Everyone from the breakfast lady to the bell boy were very professional and thoughtful. I could see however how some people would have mistaken one or two of the front desk people as not overly friendly, but nothing to write about! I felt like I got every penny that I paid for this hotel. I booked thru Expedia and got a $50 discount as well. It was worth the $270 US Dollars I paid. I would have a hard time paying any more then $325 - $350 for this hotel, but a lot of it has to do on the room. For my room, it was worth it! Breakfast was good and quaint. The hotel did an excellent job organizing taxis and gondolas. If you'd like to save a few Euro, do this by yourself -- I have this gut feeling that they make money off it but it is a great convenience. Getting to the hotel -- Please, please take either a water taxi direct or the water bus to the Sant' Angelo station - It is right there. Do not take the water bus to any other station and think you will find it. f you just missed the water bus, wait for the next one - I think they are at 50 or 55 minutes past the hour. The bathrooms were extremely clean and nice - The "jacuzzi" in the room was quite small, but I ended up using it one night regardless. We would definitely stay here again, but again at the price we got it. I will try to add photos and video later!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MontyBailey
Reviews.Content: This small, elegant boutique hotel was a delight for our entire visit. Ideally located directly on the Grand Canal, adjacent to a waterbus stop, the Palazzo Sant'Angelo cannot be beat for both convenience and luxury. Be sure to visit Bobby, the friendliest and best bartender in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: bluechip1983
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review off the back of two different stays at the hotel - I originally stayed for 3 nights other Valentines day in 2007 and subsequently booked a stay for my parents for there wedding anniversary in March of this year.(My parents were upgraded to the best room in the hotel and were given complimentary champagne). I'm typically not one for writing ( positive reviews) as I'm very much in the mind that good service or whats promosied on there website is the least you should expect.However I have taken exception with this hotel as I truely believe they go above and beyond and exceed expectations. The hotel is in the prefect position within Venice both in terms of walking between major attractions and also its walking distance proximty to the water bus rank! It also has its own wharf so if you want to impress you can get a speedboat taxi from the airport to the front door. The hotel itself is beautiful , fantastic rooms , very clean and with evrything you need. The bar is quiet and is ideal to relax after you've been out all day , or been partying and want to wind down a bit. I think what makes the hotel extra special though is the quality of the staff - who make every effort to talk to you , help/ assist in any way. In a sentence - they actually look like they enjoy being there. Both my parents and myself have travelled the world many times over and stayed in many (more expensive) hotels, though I can happily recommend this as good as anywhere you will go!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice, But you do not have to be on the Grand Canal to have a grand time”
Reviews.Author: adinaw
Reviews.Content: As a Travel agent for some years, I had heard Venice was dirty, crowded, and way over priced. This is why Venice was not at the top of my list , but when you arrive no matter how you get there, that water taxi ride to the hotel is really very exciting.(70 euros) My son was getting married at the time of the booking and planning of most of this trip so I was not very involved in the planning this time. I left it up to the two other couples we were traveling with,who had chosen this hotel becouse they had stayed at her sister hotel in Rome and liked it . This hotel is on the Grand Canal as you know, but unless your room has that Grand Canal view you are paying way more than the room was worth.(our room was about 700.00 us) I really expected a grand canal view for that, we were on the 1st floor in a small room, not much room for our clothing, the decor was nice but not at all as the "palace feel" I have read about in the other reviews. There were lots of hotels while we where walking around that looked really nice for I am sure alot less than what we paid. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was good. Location was very good, but be prepared you will get lost on foot, which is part of the charm, and there is charm around every corner. The best part of this hotel for me was the small (very small) bar. Drinking my 15.00 US glass of wine and watching the boats go by was great. I think you should be able to find for the money a hotel that is maybe more charming with more to offer, but we were not disapointed with the charm of Venice. Everyone should visit at least once.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctmb-traveller
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid-June after looking on TripAdvisor for the best hotel for us. Others have commented on the proximity to the water taxis and the ease of walking to major sites in Venice. I agree that the staff in the hotel was uniformly warm, efficient, and helpful. Our room faced a side canal and was extremely quiet. Although the fabric-covered walls were loud by current standards (wide, red, vertical stripes), they did make us feel like we really were in a Venetian palace. Very romantic! The bed was comfortable and the bathroom large and well-equipped. The entire property was extremely clean. The breakfast was quite basic for a hotel in this price range but was certainly adequate. I think part of the problem there is a lack of space to include more variety since the breakfast room is fairly small. Other reviewers commented on the high price of the hotel. While true, the price is something one knows when booking the property. The only negative experience I had was with wifi usage. I believe that a hotel as pricey as this shouldn't charge guests 3 euros an hour to access the wifi. Overall, the Palazzo Sant'Angelo sul Canal Grande is a terrific hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great room”
Reviews.Author: tracya199
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in May. I didn't realize of what a great location this was until we got there! We took the water bus (least expensive way) to the hotel- got off the water bus stop, turned right and walked a few feet to the front door! Hotel is directly on the Grand Canal. Or you can take a water taxi directly to the front door but that is a lot more expensive. The hotel is a quick walk from the Rialto bridge and San Marco square. Our room had a size canal view- very large with a king sized bed. Bathroom was also very large. The room decorations were a bit loud (not my taste) but looked nice for the hotel and being in Venice. We had breakfast included in our rate- which was a nice spread. The hotel even provided a free water taxi out to Morono- of course then you had to go on a tour of the glass factory and see all of the beautiful things! Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, not so great little breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: GBlady
Reviews.Content: I confess I don't usually frequent luxury hotels, but since it was a special wekend, we splashed out. Things we loved: the location - 20 metres from the Sant Angelo Vaporetto stop (and if you fly into Marco Polo airport, you can catch a direct, though not express, water bus - 12 euros and it feels like a private taxi!) the staff - helpful, polite, unobstrusive, welcoming. The complimentary prosecco was a nice touch, as well as their willingness to make up the room to suit us. the room - large room with little dressing area, reasonable sized sitting area, clean linen every day. We didn't try the mini bar or room service - the cost scared us. We weren't so keen on the air conditioning main vent ran though our room (47 - a tad noisy, and irritating till we twigged what it was) the breakfast room - the food was fair, but the coffee slow to arrive, and the tables are packed like sardines. I suggest you avoid the breakfast room until any tour groups have left for the day. We loved it - hope you do too

Reviews.Title: “How Much???”
Reviews.Author: Jackie17
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay for two days at this hotel for my husbands birthday. I used trip advisor as usual and felt confident with the reviews. However, the room was small and the turn down service just didnt happen although this may well have been because we questioned the price for two drinks we had in the hotel bar - we were charged 34 euros for two bacardi and cokes more than Â£30!!! RIP OFF We queried the charge which was not listed on the bar menu and were told 'our price is our price'. Well, thank you but we won't be using your chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: CTB123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 30th anniversary with a two week vacation in Italy. We started out in Venice and it was, by far, the best - due in large part to the hotel and its staff. We did not want for anything! The staff were friendly and helpful to these two first-time visitors to their city (and country). They were quick with suggestions for both fine dining and something more down to earth. They were very helpful in suggesting off-the-beaten-path spots to visit. And to top it all off, our room was huge by European standards. We asked not to be on the canal (due to our unfounded fear of there being too much noise); so we had a room at the rear that looked over a courtyard and then down a small street. Absolutely beautiful. Oh yeah..... the bar off the lobby is a great place to sit and watch the boats on the Grand Canal while you enjoy a cocktail after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A dream spot in a dream city!”
Reviews.Author: gooseontheroad
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on trip advisor after having difficulty finding a hotel which would accomodate my husband and I and our two girls without making us get separate rooms. I have stayed at most of the 5 star hotels in Venice but in my opinion the room we had rivaled them all. We booked a Grand Canal Suite which was an absolute thrill for our little ones ( age 4 and 9) who adored watching the passing boats and gondolas. My husband and I were equally delighted. The location is excellent and the staff is most accomodating and helpful. They sent a bottle of Prosecco to welcome us and cookies for the girls. We made use of staff to book several things for us and all went without a hitch. I would recommend the hotel without hesitation and should we return to the magical city I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: mic2410
Reviews.Content: Everything said in the last few reviews is correct - the hotel is amazing! The personal touch of turning down the sheets and leaving chocolates every night was really welcoming. The location is right beside the sant'angelo water bus stop which meant travelling from the airport and around venice was simple. The only downside, though this seems to be same all over venice, is that we couldn't get any food in the hotel after 11, which would normally be fine, but our plane was delayed on the way over to venice so we didnt arrive to our hotel till 11.30 and we were really hungry!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for royalty”
Reviews.Author: mylittlerileybear
Reviews.Content: Wow! Beautiful hotel and great location to explore Venice. Venice was breathtaking and all the main sights are close to the hotel. right on the Grand Canal this is a stunning hotel with friendly professional staff and when I return to Venice this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Palazzo Sant Angelo....we stayed here a couple of years ago. It confirmed our feelings from the 1st stay.....an absolutely perfect place to stay in Venice! Situated right on the Grand Canal it has its own water taxi landing which is super convenient with luggage...but don't fret there is also a waterbus landing right next to the hotel if you don't want to take a private water taxi. There are 14 rooms and they are all elegantly decorated and because it is not a large type establishment you get the feel of your own private piece of heaven in one of the most unique places on earth. Really can't say enough good things about the Palazzo, it is elegant, extremely clean and has a great very heplful staff. Bathrooms are terrific being all carrera marble with jacuzzis for some extra relaxation. It is perfectly situated with a short walk to the Rialto area and a short walk in the other direction to the St. Marks Square area. The breakfast is delicious and plentiful and served in a classy comfortable room that is very inviting. We were leaving on a late night train to Nice from Venice and the Palazzo was happy to hold our luggage after checkout in the morning until late that evening...said it was no problem which was a great relief for us. Then were great to arrange for a late water taxi to the train station for us...really couldn't have been more helpful....these are the little things that make good trips even better! One note...I was emailing the Palazzo with some questions and they had tried to get through to me by return email and were having trouble getting through so they called my home to answer my questions....now that's great service that can't be beat!!!!! Oh and while talking with them on the phone I happened to mention that we had stayed there before.....when we arrived they had given us the same room we had the first time and a bottle of champagne on ice....what a special touch....like I said we felt we were home in Venice! We would never consider staying anywhere else should we return to Venice and I surely hope we do....this is the only place for us!!! Venice and the Palazzo Sant Angelo....just magical!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant, great location”
Reviews.Author: miller041
Reviews.Content: It is hard to understand how important it is to be close to a vaporetto stop until you are in Venice. The vaporetto will take you anywhere so quickly and so easily, buy a pass right at the airport. It was so wonderful to be able to reach everything by simply stepping out of the front door (except the airport , which is not on the vaporetto route, you must either take a very inexpensive direct bus into the city, and then take the vaporetto, a great option, or take the much more expensive Alliguna or the water taxi to/from the airport/hotel) . The room was large and impeccable. And what a way to start the day --- the fabulous full breakfast was included, and had unlimited Prosecco with the orange juice. We started each day with that, as well as the fantastic cappuccino. We hardly had time to enjoy the beautiful room, we spent so much time out on the town, but it was a beautiful hotel with first class service.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bodenbabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply gorgeous and the location is fabulous too - right on the Grand Canal, next to a Vaperetto stop (where you can also catch a waterbus back to the Airport or you can make use of the hotels private jetty and have a watertaxi) so you can jump on an off buses all day long. We bought a 3 day pass which was great value at 30E - each trip (even just the one stop) is a standard 6E. This took us everywhere including Morano. You can walk from the hotel to St Marks in around 6 minutes. As soon as you enter the hotel you can feel the quality. We arrived early and expected to just leave our luggage and be asked to come back in an hour or two but the staff could not have been more helpful and our room was actually made ready for us in around 20 minutes- great service. We had paid for a double room and having read many reviews of various hotels in Venice expected it to be on the small size. We could not have been more wrong (perhaps we were upgraded? we certainly did not pay an upgraded price). The room (on the first floor - there is a lift) was very large . Had a queen size bed, desk chair, sofa (in a cute alcove), 2 TVS, fridge , large wardrobe and so much space and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was enormous too - double sink, great whirlpool bath, bidet and toilet. But it was the little extras that we loved - the turndown service (fab sheets too) where we had chocolates left on our pillows, the linen bed mat so the first thing you walked on was soft and warm, the free slippers, the lovely toiletries, the bathrobes....... and the staff - always pleasant and not at all condescending even when we dripped on the beautiful floor having been caught in a downpour! Breakfast was great too (I have NOTHING negative to say about this hotel at all). Help yourself to croissants (4 kinds!) sweet bread, fruit (strawberries, kiwis,melon) cereals, youghurt, cold meats - and a hotplate with bacon egg and sausage. Yummy. To drink Bucks Fizz,fresh OJ plus great coffee and various teas. I only wish we could have stayed longer - would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to everyone.... and we simply fell in love with Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: WynneWoody
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the other reviews, that this is a very nice small hotel, in a very convenient and beautiful location. Yes, the vaporetto (water bus) can be a bit noisy in the early morning hours, but then I imagine it's hard to avoid the noise on the canal in the mornings in any canal hotel, unless you get a room which doesn't face the canal. More sound-proof windows are a possible fix, but if that's the only drawback of this place, it was okay by us. For us, the canal view was definitely worth the noise. Staff service at the hotel is very good. Tomas, the barman, and Lamberto, the concierge, will make every effort to see that your needs are met promptly, courteously and always with a "little something extra." Another plus is the generous breakfast, which had a great selection, compared to many small European hotels. One word of advice - if you want a full canal view, be sure to specify that in your reservation, and don't rely on the booking website description of a "canal view". Some rooms have a limited or restricted view, but are still identified as having a canal view. I read something to this effect in another post, prior to traveling, and so I called the hotel to make sure our room had a full view, and it's a good thing I did, because they had to change our reservation, when I made it clear I wanted the full view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWriter100
Reviews.Content: The Plazzo Sant'Angelo was a terrific hotel. My husband & I discovered this hotel through Trip Advisor. The hotel staff is friendly and very attentive. Every time we left our room, they came in and gave us fresh towels. (Even throughout the day.) At night they turn the bed down, put chocolates on your pillow, and place a silky/linen floor mat on the carpet next to the bed----so the first thing your feet feel when you touch the ground in the morning is heavenly luxury. The hotel was very quiet and we barely saw other guests. Noise was never a factor. Our room was much bigger than we were expecting and the bathroom was huge. The entire bathroom was decorated in green and white marble. It had a toilet, a BD, a double sink vanity, his and her terrycloth robes (and slippers) and a jucuzzi tub. Our room overlooked the courtyard. At first we were really disappointed to not have a canal view room when we "requested" one, but the courtyard view was fine too. The room featured fabric/plush red wallpaper and the bed linens were the perfect texture. Breakfast the next morning was very nice. Mostly continental items but they also had scrambled eggs and bacon. The croissants with jam were delicious and the coffee came with frothy steamed milk each morning....practically cappuccinos. One morning we overslept and ate breakfast in the city and it was almost as expensive as our dinners @ night...so the free breakfast at the hotel is a very good deal. The bar in the hotel is very small --and expensive-- (without much ambiance.) But don't let that prevent you from considering this hotel. It was really nice to come back after a day of sightseeing and not have tourists over-running the place. If I ever visit Venice again, I will stay here again...we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: canada705
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Palazzo and could not have been more happy there. It is in the perfect location, right between the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. It has it's own landing stage which is great when you have a lot of luggage. There is also a water bus stop 2 stops to the right. Breakfast was great, with a choice of bacon, saugage, eggs, fruit jucies, fresh fruit, yogurt, cold meats and cheese, breads and several types of croisaant, 3 of which were filled. We had a deluxe room on the side with a small canal, but once the shutters had been closed you could neither hear nor see anything, you really had to look at a watch to see what time it was. The room was a good size as was the bathroom which had an excellent powerful shower and lovely jacuzzi bath. The robe and slippers were a great finishing touch. Staff were always extremely friendly and helpful. I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: reviewer76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Sant Angelo for only one night in July. Having only a night to spend in Venice we wanted to be somewhere central that would be easy to get to and from, and also central for the major attractions in the city. As it transpired, I did not particularly like Venice as a city to visit, but the trip was saved by the outstanding accommodation we had chosen. We booked via the Small Luxury Hotels club, and not only did we get a preferred rate, but this also got us a room upgrade, a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and a Venetian mask as a gift from the hotel. And what a room we were upgraded to! A large suite with 3 balconies right on the Grand Canal â€“ even the beautiful bathroom had a view of the canal. And all the trimmings you would hope from a top hotel: turn down with chocolates, fruit bowl on arrival, fluffy robes and slippers. The breakfast buffet was also good, although the breakfast room was very small. To be flattering it is like a very opulent railway carriage; to be critical, you could read the newspaper of a fellow diner at the opposite side of the room. The front desk staff gave us a pop-up map of Venice so we wouldnâ€™t get lost when we went out for dinner (and we almost did, even with the map!) and remembered our names and room number on our return. The location is the real seller though â€“ right on Grand Canal looking up towards Rialto, with a vaporetto stop right outside where you can catch the number 1 line, or the waterbus to the airport. I wouldnâ€™t go back to Venice, but if I did, I would stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel but somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: denlex
Reviews.Content: Two rooms and a three night stay at this hotel. Here is my experience which you may find helpful. Lobby and entrance is beautiful..polished marble and stone everywhere..very luxurious! A/C was very good..the weather in Venice was hot but the hotel lobby and our rooms were nice and cool. I had two rooms, actually they upgraded me to junior suites..both decorated with beautiful colors and glorious fabrics..beds and seating all first class... but there is more to say...the first room was wonderful...Two windows, quite spacious for Venice, good layout and a beautiful marble bathroom. The second room was the problem...although the bathroom was large, the room layout was very awkward and claustrophobic...long, narrow room...hardly enough room to get to the other side of the bed....and only one window. They called it a jr suite because it had a small alcove with a love seat, but that was hardly useful. So... when you book make sure you do not get one of those rooms. The location...it is right on the grand canal...however in my opinion this hotel is only worthwhile if you have a direct front canal view....the minor canal view on the side is only good for seeing the laundry trucks and adjacent building wall, like an alley way... and not much light gets in....so if you book here, make sure to ask if you are getting a direct front room...otherwise I personally would look elsewhere. Another word on location...the hotel is right on the grand canal next to a vaporetto stop which makes using the vaporetto very convenient, but if you don't need to be on the water and you prefer to be in a more central area near shops, cafes and night life... then this hotel is definitely out of the way...nothing right near by...everything is a walk ..not really a far walk but a walk nonetheless...sometimes we felt like we needed a little spot nearby..but there is none. So you have to decide what you need..vaporetto convenience or proximity to a little action. Many hotels have both conveniences..this hotel does not. The food...I only had the included breakfasts here...and in my most recent trip to Italy which also included Florence and Rome...this hotel had the poorest breakfast by far...very meager and somewhat unhelpful staff attending the breakfast area...took a long time to replenish items which had run out...and the selection was quite poor as well...I was quite disappointed to see that the breakfast here was very very inferior to our other hotels in Florence and Rome which were much cheaper hotels...and the breakfast room is very small...quite cramped and you are seated very close to others..somewhat uncomfortable and in my opinion unacceptable for a hotel charging these rates. The reception staff was good...they are happy to help you with a smile...so no complaints there..they arranged a canal cruise and some transfers for me very happily. However...I should mention that I had to leave the hotel at 6 A.M. to catch an early airport flight and there was only one staff member there at that hour...which meant I had to bring all the bags down myself and although I requested some coffee they could not or would not provide it. Again this was unacceptable to me in a hotel of this price caliber. Internet access...I had my own laptop and wifi was good throughout the hotel but nonetheless the terms for access are ridiculous and overpriced...in my florence hotel I had free access... and in my rome hotel you could buy an hour of time and use that time over your entire stay...but here they charge you three euro for one consecutive hour...and you cannot carry over unused time...so each time you want to check your email or check a website for info you have to pay another three euro if it is in a different hour..so you have to plan your internet time very carefully...checking your email three times a day would mean three internet episodes of three euro each...to me this was unacceptable in a hotel that charges this type of rate. Room service...I only ordered drinks and the bartender delivered within minutes...I should mention that two glasses of orange juice and a bucket of ice was about 25 euro...so buyer beware!! In conclusion...although this was the priciest hotel I stayed at on my trip..by far...for me it was really the biggest disappointment...lots of things bothered me...So on my next trip to venice i will look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: TexasLonghorn6
Reviews.Content: Staying right on the Grand Canal in Venice is amazing. This hotel is superbly located, with it's own vaparetto stop. It is very luxurious and our room was huge!!! We stayed here for 2 nights in April and were extremely glad we did. The hotel was richly appointed and had the feel of a boutique hotel, right on the water. Given the ease of catching the vaparetto or walking, the location couldn't be beat. We'd definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Grand_Tour_Spain
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of Sant Angelo (in part due to the many positive reviews here at Tripadvisor). It is a small "boutique" hotel with attentive and friendly staff, exclusively decorated rooms in classic Venetian style and a first class location next to Canal Grande (and a vaporetto stop) between St Marks and the Rialto. We stayed in a suite with abalcony towards Grand Canale and the views were truly excellent. A perfect place for honeymoons (as in our case) and romantic weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Courtnell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Canal suite, booked direct which turned out to be the cheapest way of doing it. A splendid view of the Grand Canal from a reasonably big room and sitting room. The hotel has its own jetty so taxis can drop off right outside. It is also VERY near the vaporetto stop and that is the only drawback. These water buses are very noisy and seem to turn round at this stop which makes even more noise. They start around 5am and go on until at least midnight. You can sleep but it is not peaceful. Apart from that, hotel was very good. Helpful staff, clean rooms, great breakfast. If you arrange a water taxi through the hotel thy charge an extra 60 Euros. And if yout try to call direct they won't do it except through the hotel. We went up to Rialto Bridge where there is a taxi rank and aksed to be taken to hotel jetty where we picked up bags - for 60 Eruros less.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: PattieB
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Italy, I wanted a hotel overlooking a canal in Venice. Our stay at Palazzo Sant'Angelo exceeded my dreams! We arrived at the dock in front of the hotel, were greeted by a pleasant gentleman at the front desk, and shown to our upgraded room overlooking the Grand Canal! We watched the boats plying the canal from our balcony during the day, then shuttered the windows at night for a quiet and dark sleep. The breakfast was satisfying - although the dining room is small and crowded. The hotel staff suggested several restaurants and patiently coordinated our gondola ride for the last night (when I waited until the last minute to make the request). Take the gondola at night - much more romantic and quiet and peaceful. The hotel was convenient to everything, with a waterbus stop next door. It was the perfect place for my first (but not last) visit to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyccouple23
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. Nothing less than perfection. We are a very picky New York City couple and the hotel was without fault. Great spacious room. Comfy bed with very nice linen. Large modern bathroom with Jacuzzi. Gorgeous tile and wall covering everywhere. Fantastic view of the canal. Convenient to St Marks and Rialto Bridge. Only a few steps from the Vaporetto stop. Please note that Line 1 that serves this stop only runs until 11:45 PM. Otherwise you have to walk from Rialto or St Marks which is easy once you know where you are going. Great breakfast of fresh pastries and fruit. Incredible espresso to get my engine running in the morning. The staff was great and recommended several outstanding local non tourist restaurants. We booked a Winter special that was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: seery1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay, Great location right in the center of all the attractions. Vaporetto stop right in front of the hotel. We were upgraded from a regular room to a mini suite. Great room. Great free buffet breakfast. Staff very friendly. A really good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SMHazelwood
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from three nights at this hotel and it was excellent. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, with big, firm beds and luxurious linen sheets, and a wonderful bathroom. The rooms and the whole hotel are spotlessly clean, the staff are helpful and speak very good English. Breakfast was very good except for the coffee, which is disappointing. The hotel is well located, next to a waterbus stop and it is very quiet and peaceful. The only slight niggle was that on two of the mornings I was woken at 7.15 to the sound of the rubbish being collected by boat in the side alley of the hotel. The boat keeps its engines roaring for fifteen minutes, so no chance of dropping off again. Otherwise, it was perfect and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: azraf
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Palazzo Sant'Angelo and Venice in general. Venice is a beautiful jewel of a city. The Palazzo is a very nice super clean place. The staff was excellent. My room was very comfortable and the quiet is so beautiful. I found the red and yellow decor a little much at first (I don't like red in a sleeping room), but I was o.k. by the second day. I never slept on linen sheets before. There was a very nice beauty salon and spa directly across the canal. Breakfast was good. The main thing about Venice is to try to figure out the waterbuses 1st. It will make it much easier. You definately need a map when you leave the hotel and even then it can be frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for Venice”
Reviews.Author: marathon123
Reviews.Content: II've been to Venice three times and this was my first stay here, for four nights. It's a very nice hotel with a convenient location right at a vaporetto stop and a relatively short walk to the Rialto and Palazzo San Marco (like the rest of Venice, there is no direct road to anything, but this is a good location). Linens, towels, upholstery, and the like were all very good quality. The bed was very firm, which is great if you like that. The windows had heavy drapes available to block out boat noise and ensure a good night's sleep. The air conditioning worked very well in the hot weather. Room service and housekeeping were excellent. One caution: do not be lured by a room on a side canal if you really want a room on the Grand Canal. The side canal is the Venice equivalent of an alley in any other city. Your view will be of the building next door, some 15 feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo was gorgeous- but don't stay out past midnight”
Reviews.Author: AHagelshaw
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Sant'Angelo is a very nice hotel, in a GORGEOUS location. Right on the grand canal, with views to die for. Pricey, but for our honeymoon trip to Italy it was a great choice. The folks there gave us one of the best rooms on the front of the hotel, with a balcony opening out over the canal. Almost too perfect to be true! They gave us complementary champagne, and the turn down service at night was very nice. They have a pleasant little bar on the ground floor, and a decent breakfast. There is a vaporetto stop just yards away from the front of the hotel, easy to get anywhere in the city quickly, once we got the hang of it. Everyone at the front desk was nice, with one notable exception. Here's our one bad experience, which was enough for us to rate our stay four stars instead of five. On our last night we got back to the hotel after having dinner out. It was 12:30AM, not too late for us. But for Venice, an early to bed city, it was apparently too late for the hotel. We were shocked to find the front door locked (!!) and the front desk completely deserted. To make things worse, we were caught in the rain and were already wet from our walk home. Mind you, this is a good sized hotel, not a small place. We freaked out and started knocking and ringing our door bell repeatedly- with no answer. Finally, after 15 minutes of standing in now pouring rain, we went to the hotel next door- whose front door was still open, thank you very much- and asked for help. They called on the phone for us, but still no answer. Their person went with us over to the Sant'Angelo, and literally leaned on the door bell. FINALLY our staff person appeared from somewhere in the back, and let us in. We were grateful to be inside, and though upset, would have been OK if the Sant'Angelo employee had seemed apologetic. Instead, he scolded us about not leaving our key with him when we left the hotel at 6PM, so he would know we were out- a "policy" no one had ever mentioned. When we said perhaps the problem was the fact that he wasn't at his post, he had the nerve to argue and be angry with us- all the while we are the customers, soaking wet and cold from having been locked out of our own hotel. The following day, we told our story to the morning people at the desk. They were apologetic, but offered no other compensation for our unpleasant experience. SO- this hotel is indeed beautiful- just don't stay out past midnight!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyNovice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a stay in Venice. It is absolutely worth the price - especially compared to other hotels in Italy we stayed in. The breakfast is excellent (hard to find in Italy, trust me), the service is 5 star. They let us take the boat's personal water taxi to Murano and helped us with directions and fabulous restaurant recommendations (Ai Mercante is the best place we ate in Venice - also amazing!). The rooms and the hotel are immaculate. Loved this hotel. Should I ever return to Venice (and I hope to), I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll like this one”
Reviews.Author: gbonsall
Reviews.Content: We stayed in July 2006. To get here from the train station just hop on a Vaperato on the grand canal and get off at the St Angelo stop. It's not far at all. You will see the hotel from the Vaperato and it is only 50 feet from the stop. Great breakfast. If your not happy with this I would be surprised. The room we had #220 had a view of the garden. Not great but the view of the canal rooms are Junior Sites and are about $100 more per night. We paid $400/night. Great service,very clean rooms. No traffic patterns on the carpet. Our room had a living room area,bedroom and ample bath. To go to the airport cheaply just get back on the Vaperato right out side of the hotel and take it to Pt. Roma(1 or 2 stops past the train station. Get off and buy a ticket for about $2.50. It is at the A-1 stop bus # 5. These busses are just like the ones in the states that take you to the car rental places at airports in the USA,quite modern with areas for luggage. The "water taxis" are $130 one way. Not neccesary unless you have money to burn. This property is very convienent and out of the way from the crowded areas. There are nice Piazzos very close. This is a nice property and your wife will love it. My credit card company did a fraud check while I was staying here and the front desk at thier expence and insistance paid for a call to the USA. Nice. Quaint bar and lounging area. No internet as of yet though. They say it's coming soon. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Batting .500”
Reviews.Author: Jayhawkfan
Reviews.Content: The positive reviews of this hotel are warranted; great location, clean, modern, wondrful room and bathroom, friendly and helpful staff, especially the bartender, Thomasss (no typo). Had it been Novemeber there would be no "howevers", however it is July, and as I write this review I have finished a sleepless night with no air conditioning (the first night was great). The entire 4th floor is hot and the whole hotel is warm - and no breeze througth the windows. An unfortunate ending to an otherwise great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Bruinett
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was clean, up to date, and had the best bathroom of all of the hotels that we stayed in, in Italy. The staff, while not jumping up and down to help you, get the job done. They took care of all of our needs. They even got my husband a toothbrush when his suitcase was lost. The hotel was very easy to get to using the inexpensive water bus from the train station (Ferrovia). We thought that the hotel was romantic and had a good location. Our standard room was nicely sized given the size of hotel rooms in Europe. And the bathroom was downright big. We would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't open the windows”
Reviews.Author: corvinus
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel and getting to it from the airport couldn't be easier. Buy a bus ticket in the airport concourse for Piazzale Roma ( fare 3 euros); buses leave every 30 minutes. The water-bus from the bus terminus at P.Roma ( vaporetto no.1) will take you to San Angelo and the hotel entrance is beside the landing-stage. The cost of the single journey is 5 euros and you might consider buying a ticket for a longer period because it can work out expensive if you use the vaporetto extensively during your stay. The hotel is welcoming and the rooms are comfortable and quiet; the loudest thing in our room was the wallpaper. Maid service is of the highest standard and towel and bed-sheet changing is frequent to the point of being excessive. We did find the room a bit stuffy on the first night and we made the mistake of opening the windows. The mosquitoes swarmed in and we were badly bitten; lesson, take repellent. By the second night the air-conditioning had taken over and we had no more trouble. Breakfast is very good and plentiful. No hotel restaurant during our stay but there are good restaurants nearby; none of them are cheap ( nothing is in Venice). Budget for about 40 euros per person for a dinner with wine. The hotel is almost equidistant from San Marco and Rialto and both are within walking distance; as is Accademia which is a very short distance away and is the most interesting and charming part of the city. The touts will offer to take you from San Marco to Murano by water-taxi for nothing but do bear in mind that they won't bring you back unless you buy some of their gaudy and expensive glass. Go, nevertheless, Murano is worth a visit, good lunches available, and you can always come back on the' vaporetto'. Returning to the airport; as a variation, use the alilaguna from San Marco; a journey of about 60 minutes and costing 11 euros. A good way to leave the city but a long walk from the landing-stage to the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel, with great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Because tripadvisor was so helpful in planning my trip, I promised myself I would give reports on all the places we stayed throughout Italy. This was one of my favorite hotels that we stayed at. The staff was very helpful and curtious. They arranged everything we asked for. The rooms were very nicely equiped and clean. The location couldnt be better, being both on the grand canal and footsteps away from a water bus pickup and drop off. Additionally they have a private dock where water taxi's can be arranged to pick you up and drop you off. The location to popular attractions and sites couldnt be better, with the rialto bridge in clear sight, and St. Marks on a 5-8 min walk through the charming alleyways of Venice. Furthermore, went we mentioned to the concierge that we were leaving for florence where we would be staying with another hotel in the Sina Hotel group, he called ahead and arranged for us to get the best room available. Without us asking. Wouldnt you know it, upon arriving in Florence and checking in, we came to find that his thoughtful gesture had awarded us a wonderful room with a wonderful view. It's these little things that make the difference when traveling, and we really appreciated it. I recommend this hotel without hessitation, and can't wait to plan my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: labern116
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very easy to get to. From the airport, take the bus to Piazzale Roma (3 euro). Then walk to water buses and take #1 (5 euro) to Sant Angelo stop. Go to the right along the water and hotel is 2nd door. Great location for dragging luggage. Nice rooms. Big bathroom. Some construction going on in hotel so they offer included breakfast as room service. Room was ready when we arrived at 11:30 am. After reading the hotel reviews, I picked this hotel. Check all the hotel websites since prices vary. I used Hoteltravel. We were not disappointed. I would recommend this hotel and stay here again. Weather was a little chilly and damp.
